results.title: The House of names
results.brief_description: John Smith is convinced that changing his name will change his life. After trying out hundreds of name combinations he sets off for the registry office. But choosing a new name is only the beginning. His journey takes him to the heart of bureaucracy, and what he finds is not only a new identity but a common soul. Cast includes Kym Gyngell, Samuel Johnson, Tom Stringer, Maureen Sherlock.

results.title: The Majority vote
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “What Do You Think”.
A film designed to provoke discussion on the question of whether the elected representative of a group may legitimately support a measure which is disliked by the majority of electors. A situation is presented in which a class of high-school students voice their disapproval of the support given by their student council representative to a measure curtailing their extracurricular activities. In defending her action the representative gives adequate reasons for her support of the measure. The audience is invited to express its opinions.

results.title: One man's opinion
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “What Do You Think”.
First in a series of discussion-provoking subjects, this film shows how one person’s judgment might reasonably run counter to the majority opinion. This is illustrated in a high-school classroom where a campaign is under way to raise funds for a school project. One student, although he believes in the cause, withholds his support because he disapproves of the high-pressure methods which put individuals on the spot if they are unable to or do not wish to contribute. The audience is asked for their appraisal.

results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.

results.title: The Third Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 1 of “The Miracle Planet” series which examines craters and meteorites and the clues they provide for understanding the origin of the Earth and its atmosphere. It also shows the ways meteorite impacts continue to affect the planet.

results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.title: Patterns in the Air
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 4 “Patterns in the air” examines the atmosphere that envelops the Earth. This surprisingly thin cocoon supports all life on Earth. The distance between the tops of trees to the fringes of outer space is only a few miles, yet that blanket of water and gases has made Earth unique.

results.title: The Dulugar
results.creator_credit: James Hackell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.

results.title: Succession from sand dune to forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Explains that succession is the process by which a given area changes slowly and continuously until it finally becomes a stable community. Shows one of the earliest and most thoroughly studied examples of this process on the shore of Lake Michigan

results.title: The Home Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The home planet is the final volume of “The miracle planet” series and looks at some of the major questions confronting the human race. With our population growing, the supply of our resources dwindling, our atmosphere threatened, and the spectre of malnutrition and starvation haunting more and more of the Earth’s population, what are the prospects for the planet continuing to support human life?
